title: Can someone at Riot at least LOOK at the Thresh hook hitbox?
body:
I understand that it gets wider towards the end of the skillshot (which is also a pretty dumb idea), but this is just stupid. 

http://imgur.com/rV9NDP2

It's also literally magnetic to minions, whereas a hook may graze a champion at the same distance (a champion who, I would like to note, has a BIGGER hitbox than a minion) and it whiffs.  The skillshot is messed up.  Just fix it.

EDIT: I love Thresh. This is not an "omfg op hook nerf thresh qq" thread.  He is my favorite champion.  I even cosplayed Thresh.  But I'm capable of recognizing an unfair advantage, and the widening, magnetic hook is exactly that.

This isn't the only reason this is noticeable. There are several factors that make Thresh's hitbox an issue.

1) Thresh doesn't face the way he's going to toss the hook before he tosses it, which is intentional and also _removes counterplay_ for the other player.

2) Unlike other skill shots, hooks like Death Sentence, Rocket Grab and Zenith Blade can literally lose a fight because of how punished the team is for getting hit by it. It should be the player's skill that determines the swinginess of such a powerful ability, not a broken hitbox or a lack of telegraph. (The skill should be Thresh's to hit, not the enemy team's to dodge).

3) Skill shots with a stun attached to them are much more visible when they don't hit you because you can't do anything except stare at your screen wondering how the hell they hit you (your champion can't take any actions for another 1.5 seconds anyway).

This isn't specific to Thresh's hook and it's due to perspective bias. Depending on the angle you're looking at your champion (where your screen is relative to your champion) it may or may not look like your champion is being hit by a certain ability.

I think they need to normalize the in-game perspective so that there isn't a huge different between what you're seeing and what's happening in the code. Right now situations like this can happen for many different abilities.

**TL;DR**
Not just Thresh. It's because of perspective bias.
